alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Cherokee and southeastern Pickens Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Ball Ground, or 8 miles northeast of Canton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Ball Ground, Nelson, Buffington, Free Home, Union Hill, Holbrook, Lathemtown, Tate and Reavis Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
